task.title: Grafu teorijas pamati

learners.prerequisite_knowledge: 8th grade students have experience with graph theory basics, including vertex degrees, traversing graphs, planar graphs, paths, cycles, and trees. They may not have formal olympiad experience but are preparing for one and should be comfortable with proofs, examples, and optimization-style questions.
learners.likes: They enjoy informal language and the animated series Arcane.
learners.dislikes: Overly formal presentation may not engage them.

task.format_notes: Worksheet is for an upcoming regional olympiad prep class (90 min), targeting 8th grade students who prefer an informal tone and like the Arcane animation series. The worksheet should include 10 problems in total: 2 introductory problems, a concise theory overview (covering: graph theory basics, vertex degrees, graph traversals, planar graphs without edge crossings, paths, cycles, trees), followed by 8 problems of increasing difficulty. Problems should vary in style—proofs, examples, optimization tasks—in an olympiad format. Include summary-form solutions (not full sample answers) for all problems at the end of the worksheet.
